docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats moved swiftly to assail Republican senators for voting against a major Medicare bill that would have averted a 10 percent cut in payments to doctors.

headline.main: Senate Democrats Attack Republicans on Medicare
headline.print_headline: Senate Democrats Attack Republicans on Medicare

docs.snippet: Democrats moved swiftly to assail Republican senators for voting against a major Medicare bill that would have averted a 10 percent cut in payments to doctors.

docs.lead_paragraph: Following is the second and final set of answers from Judy Wessler, the director of the Commission on the Public's Health System. This week, Ms. Wessler was answering questions about health care services for children and young people and about access to care for the uninsured. We are no longer accepting questions for this feature.

headline.main: Answers About Child Health Care, Part 2

docs.abstract: Taking Questions: The final set of answers from Judy Wessler, the director of the Commission on the Public's Health System, about health care services for children and young people in New York, as well as access to care for the uninsured.
docs.snippet: Taking Questions: The final set of answers from Judy Wessler, the director of the Commission on the Public's Health System, about health care services for children and young people in New York, as well as access to care for the uninsured.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans and Democrats blame each other for the Senate’s failure to prevent an automatic 10 percent cut in doctors’ payments before leaving for recess.

headline.main: Doctors Face Payment Cuts for Patients on Medicare
headline.print_headline: Doctors Face Payment Cuts For Medicare

docs.snippet: Republicans and Democrats blame each other for the Senate’s failure to prevent an automatic 10 percent cut in doctors’ payments before leaving for recess.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the most unusual legislative sessions in state history has come to a close.

docs.lead_paragraph: Baseball’s safety and health advisory committee could enact more stringent qualifications for companies to be approved to make major league bats.

headline.main: As Bats Shatter, Baseball Considers New Rules
headline.print_headline: Makers of Maple Bats Face Change in Rules

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite a veto threat, the House moved to prevent a 10 percent cut in Medicare payments to doctors that was scheduled to take effect July 1.

headline.main: House Votes to Block Cut in Doctors’ Medicare Fees
headline.print_headline: House Votes to Block Cut In Doctors’ Medicare Fees

docs.snippet: Despite a veto threat, the House moved to prevent a 10 percent cut in Medicare payments to doctors that was scheduled to take effect July 1.

docs.lead_paragraph: Medicare pays $110 for a walker that Wal-Mart sells for $60, and medical equipment makers like it that way.
